We are working to collect links to active user groups to help Ubuntu users connect with one another.  Your <nowiki>[[..-|participation]]</nowiki> is appreciated. The regions are sorted alphabetically and then sorted by the monthly meeting date.

Since <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California|California]]</nowiki> is a huge state with 58 counties and yet <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California#Cities.2C_towns_and_counties|68%]]</nowiki> of the population resides in just three statistical areas (Greater LA, SF Bay Area & Inland Empire) we have used the measures used nationwide to group the areas of the state.  <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_metropolitan_area|Metropolitan Statistical Areas]]</nowiki> (MSAs) and combined statistical areas (CSAs) are used by the <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_of_Management_and_Budget|US OMB]]</nowiki> and we use the same system for the regions of our state as well.

=== Central Valley ===
<nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_Central_Valley|Central Valley]]</nowiki> wikipedia - <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Fresno|Metropolitan Fresno]]</nowiki> CSA, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sacramento_metropolitan_area|Sacramento metro]]</nowiki> CSA (El Dorado, Placer, Sacramento, Yolo, Yuba & Sutter counties), <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bakersfield,_CA_MSA|Bakersfield]]</nowiki> MSA (Kern County), <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modesto,_CA_MSA|Modesto]]</nowiki> MSA (Stanislaus County), <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visalia-Porterville,_CA_MSA|Visalia-Porterville]]</nowiki> MSA (Tulare County), <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merced,_CA_MSA|Merced]]</nowiki> MSA, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chico,_CA_MSA|Chico]]</nowiki> MSA (Butte County), <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Redding,_CA_MSA|Redding]]</nowiki> MSA (Shasta County). I see information about the inclusion of the <nowiki>[[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stockton-Lodi,_CA_Metropolitan_Statistical_Area|San Joaquin]]</nowiki> in both the Central Valley and SF Bay Area now.

=== San Francisco Bay Area ===
San Francisco <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco_Bay_Area|Bay Area]]</nowiki> has a <nowiki>[[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Jose-San_Francisco-Oakland,_CA_Combined_Statistical_Area|Combined Statistical Area]]</nowiki> which includes the standard nine counties plus <nowiki>[[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Joaquin_County,_California|San Joaquin]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santa_Cruz_County,_California|Santa Cruz]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Benito_County,_California|San Benito]]</nowiki>. The nine Bay Area counties include  <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alameda_County,_California|Alameda]]</nowiki> County, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Contra_Costa_County,_California|Contra Costa]]</nowiki> County, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marin_County,_California|Marin]]</nowiki> County, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Napa_County,_California|Napa]]</nowiki> County, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco|San Francisco]]</nowiki> County, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Mateo_County,_California|San Mateo]]</nowiki> County, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santa_Clara_County,_California|Santa Clara]]</nowiki> County, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solano_County,_California|Solano]]</nowiki> County, and <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonoma_County,_California|Sonoma]]</nowiki> County

There are numerous Linux and Open Source and related User Groups in and around the San Francisco Bay Area.
Rather than an almost guaranteed to always be out-of-date list here, you may want to check one or more of these generally well curated lists/calendars, and also the respective User Group web sites, etc.:<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[http://linuxmafia.com/bale/|Bay Area Linux Events (BALE)]]</nowiki><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://www.google.com/calendar/embed?src=caj9iea2ol69b7n2uqdek4ocso%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America/Los_Angeles|SF Bay Area Open Source/Linux Events (Google Calendar)]]</nowiki><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[http://www.svlug.org/farm.php#other-local|Other (Linux, Unix, Software, etc.) Local Groups]]</nowiki><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[http://www.lugod.org/calendar/|Upcoming Local Linux Events]]</nowiki>
